embeds.title: Bag of Tricks
embeds.description:
Common Relic / The Collector / Downfall

At the start of each combat, draw 2 Collected cards.
*Tricky.*

messages.content: I for one would heavily prefer to find tricky's rod over tricky's sack
but yeah this relic sucks
collector already has problems with hand clog
and you can't afford the collected cards yet because you have no reserves (it's turn one)
so you're probably forced to waste a collected card
also
BALLS
I would like this discussion to be about hand clog on collector, its various causes, and solutions.
A gigantic source of hand clog is embers, especially <sunbloom kindling>.

messages.content: I tried playing a collector deck on a few runs recently and i've encountered a fair bit of success. With  <Greenpyre Locus> and <Forgery> + <Brain Drain> you can generate quite a lot of collected cards. I found that having many <Louse> added to the collected deck was very usefull as Slimeboss said, and Omen felt very good since i chose mainly 0 cost collected cards like <Mystic>

embeds.title: Mystic
embeds.description:
Normal / 48-56 (50-58) HP / Slay the Spire

**:intent_ad: Attack**
```ansi
[2;31m8 [2;34m(9). [0;2mApplies [2;31m2 [2;33mFrail.
```**:intent_f: Heal**
```ansi
[0;2mHeals all enemies for [2;31m16 [2;34m(20).
```**:intent_f: Buff**
```ansi
[0;2mApplies [2;31m2 [2;34m(3) (4) [2;33mStrength [0;2mto all enemies.
```
If the total amount of HP that the enemy team is missing is at least 16 (21 if A17), will use Heal. Otherwise has a 40%/60% chance to use Buff/Heal.
Cannot use any move three times in a row. On A17, cannot use Attack twice in a row.

messages.content: why yes i would like uppercut+
but common

Honestly I often have a small enough collector deck that I don't _want_ it all in my hand on turn 1 because I won't be able to play 3 of them and they will evaporate, so I often have skipped this relic
so your style of collecting is akin to Blue Guy's
"i'm only going to take louse and mystic because I want bag of tricks to 'pop off'" *gets targeted for 40 by slavers*
sneaky gremlin also works

If you have this early you can plan around having it, and there's an argument to be made that getting to your important collected cards quickly out values losing a few ones, but regardless it's worse than bag of prep for sure

I largely agree with the sentiment that this is an awkward relic, that has a reasonably high potential to be actively detrimental. The reality of collected cards is that every one that you take makes it harder to draw the rest because you only draw 1 per turn (and costs essence as well). If your collected pile has 10 cards in it, you will not see a really powerful/important option (lagavulin, corpse explosion, nemesis, book of stabbing) until turn 5 or later half the time. This incentivizes drafting relatively small collected decks so that you can see your best cards faster and more frequently. It needs to be large enough to function as ring of the serpent for short fights (at least 3-5 cards), but not so large that you can't find your best cards in time. This is further complicated by wanting to have a functioning ring of the serpent as early in the run as possible, which may require taking some less than optimal collected cards from your first few hallway fights in act 1, though louse is quite good if you can find it, and if you can find an early tri-sentries or lagavulin, that's a great way to fill the early collected deck.

Back to bag of tricks. The issue here is that if you are trying to have a relatively small collected deck with high impact cards in it, then you are going to draw too many of them on turn 1, and you probably will not be able to play them all without making suboptimal decisions/taking chip damage. You might also just not have enough energy, depending on if you have the 4th energy yet, swapped out your starter relic, or the collected cards you took were particularly expensive ones. If you are running dark apotheosis, you can lose out on those upgrades as well by drawing so many collected cards on turn 1. It is worth noting that if you have lantern, donu's washers, mummified hand, or other ways to cheat energy on turn 1, bag of tricks can become very good as a way to accelerate your gameplan. Bottled flame on fiend fire can also wreck with this.

If for some inadvisable reason, you are running a very large collected deck full of low impact/cheap cards, bag of tricks does become better in that spot as well. If you have a few key powers like book of stabbing or reptomancer that you really want to draw as fast as possible mixed in with lower impact cards, bag of tricks is also good there to dig you to your key scaling pieces earlier in fights. Just having more options can also be useful in and of itself, (assuming you have a varied toolbox of a collected deck) we don't tend to complain about not being able to play everything that we draw from ring of the snake/bag of preparation. To be fair, those relics are really different from bag of tricks because the collected deck is so much more customizable and curated when compared to the main deck, and notably doesn't have strikes/defends/frontloaded damage commons that were mainly taken to get through act 1. 

I would certainly think very carefully about where my collected deck is going before buying this at a store (and hopefully before picking it up from a random reward as well, but it's harder to remember that you can skip relics in those spots). There is significant potential for it to be awkward when played alongside the most conventionally powerful collected deck strategy, but it can also really shine under the right circumstances, especially with those ways to cheat energy on turn 1. Multiple copies or a bottled Double trouble can be quite powerful with this to give you better selection as to what you double. I think there is a reasonable argument for making this a shop relic rather than a common relic because of how situational it is, and because it can be actively bad/awkward in a fair number of spots.

I don't agree that this is an awkward relic, I think its outright broken for being a mere common relic. This relic is effectively bag of preparation, but its instead drawing 3 highly valuable collection cards; cards you can normally get only once per turn. There are too many busted collectable cards to even name off, but getting any 2 more of them on turn one basically will always get you a good turn one. Especially if you have many situational cards since your getting 3 its fine to have 1 of those cards be a dud since you have 2 more to play; minimizing the risk of taking some of the more situational ones like darklings, red slaver and sphere. While you do have to acutally play the collectable cards due to the megaetheral, thats usually fine since those cards are so powerful that it doesn't matter much if you miss out on playing a normal card if your instead playing one thats much better for your energy.

I have never regretted taking this relic. Even in runs where I also had bag of preperation and got a super big starting hand, I still never regretted it. Since having 10 cards to start turn one with is always better then having 6 cards; even if i'm giving up some that added consistency is more then worth it.

the only time I can fathom skipping this is if you already have several relics that all add to your hand on turn one, like having a toolbox, bowler hat and toolbox. But such runs are rare so this isn't really an issue and I don't think it takes much away from this relics power.
<omen> also benefits immensely from having this relic; even after Omen was changed its new version is still quite powerful and worth building around.

embeds.title: Omen
embeds.description:
Rare Power / 1 :energy_collector: / The Collector / Downfall

 (**Innate**.)
Whenever you play a Collected card, gain 1 **Strength** :p_strength:.

messages.content: admittedly a large part of me liking this relic is that i'm not too picky with my collected deck. I don't take trash cards but I do tend to take all of the good cards without thinking twice; often ending up with a collected pile with over a dozen cards in it. I have done runs with deliberately small piles too. But its simpler to do runs where you stack your deck and collection with powerful high value cards and just overpower the game. Rather then creating a deck that has one gameplan it was to do every fight.
